title: Digital Marketing
text: This section highlights digital marketing work I’ve done independently and with small clients, focusing on real-world experiences outside of school that helped me build strategic and creative skills.

title: Digital Marketing
text:
Local Pop-Up Campaign: “Weekend Treats Market”
I partnered with a weekend pop-up food market to develop a digital strategy to boost local awareness and foot traffic. My role included:

Creating branded flyers and Instagram content tailored to Gen Z and family audiences

Running a 10-day Instagram countdown with polls and vendor previews

Launching a geotargeted Instagram ad campaign with a limited $75 budget

The campaign led to a 40% increase in follower engagement and helped the market reach capacity by noon on opening weekend. This project taught me how to work with tight budgets, fast timelines, and grassroots-level branding.

title: Digital Marketing
section: Social Content Launch: “Coach & Create” Personal Training
text:
Social Content Launch: “Coach & Create” Personal Training
I worked as a freelance digital content assistant for a local personal trainer building her first brand identity online. I helped her:

Design a logo and branded Canva templates for daily posts

Develop a 30-day posting calendar that balanced fitness tips, testimonials, and behind-the-scenes content

Set up Linktree and Instagram Story Highlights to guide users through services

By the end of the 30 days, she gained over 150 new followers, booked two new clients through DMs, and continued using the templates for weeks. It helped me understand the content needs of new, solo entrepreneurs and how branding can build credibility quickly.

title: Digital Marketing
text:
Pop Culture-Based Campaign: “Screen & Stream Saturdays”
Inspired by my interest in content creation and entertainment, I conceptualized a social media series called “Screen & Stream Saturdays” — a weekly post format that blended binge-worthy shows with creative ad mockups.
I created: - Graphics pairing fictional ad campaigns with trending shows (e.g., a skincare ad for a drama series character)
- Sample captions, hashtags, and engagement hooks like “Who wore it better?” or “Which character needs this the most?”
- A portfolio of mockups to show off my eye for trend-based digital marketing
Though not tied to a client, the project allowed me to experiment with voice, visual storytelling, and social humor — and served as a creative testbed for campaign ideas.

title: Digital Marketing
text:
Takeaways
These projects helped me gain hands-on experience building and promoting content from the ground up. Whether supporting small business owners or experimenting with pop culture formats, I’ve learned how to combine design, planning, and marketing intuition to reach real audiences in digital spaces.

title: Cynthia Garcia
text: I’m Cynthia Garcia, a Business Administration student with a concentration in Marketing at Cal Poly Pomona. This site serves as a portfolio of my academic and professional experience, with an emphasis on marketing analytics, digital strategy, and applied data analysis.

title: Cynthia Garcia
text:
Background
Through my coursework in Market Analysis and Control, I’ve developed a strong foundation in data-driven marketing. I’ve worked with real survey datasets to examine how consumer behavior varies across regions and industries, using tools such as RStudio, Quarto, and GitHub to organize and present findings in clear, professional formats.
In addition to academic projects, I’ve contributed to freelance digital marketing efforts for small businesses and community organizations. These experiences helped me refine my approach to content creation, performance tracking, and strategic messaging across different platforms.

title: Cynthia Garcia
text:
Technical Skills
My work involves: - Cleaning and analyzing data using R (dplyr, ggplot2, t.test)
- Communicating insights through visualizations and Quarto presentations
- Building professional web content and portfolio materials using GitHub and RStudio
- Supporting digital campaigns through social content and branded visuals

title: Cynthia Garcia
text:
Purpose
This portfolio is designed to demonstrate my ability to merge data analysis with creative marketing work. Each section showcases different areas of focus, from market research projects to digital content strategy. My goal is to continue developing these skills in roles that value insight-driven planning and effective communication.
Thank you for visiting.

title: Marketing Analytics
text: This section features both coursework and independent projects that reflect my experience using data to inform marketing decisions. My work blends statistical analysis, survey insights, and visual storytelling to uncover trends and guide strategy.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Coffee Shop Perception Analysis (Class Project)
In my Market Analysis and Control course, I worked on a project examining how customer perceptions of sanitation protocols varied across states during the COVID-19 pandemic, specifically focusing on major chain coffee shops.
Using RStudio, I: - Cleaned and transformed survey data using dplyr
- Conducted independent-sample t-tests to compare safety perceptions between states
- Visualized results with ggplot2 bar graphs and boxplots
This project helped me connect real consumer behavior with data interpretation and understand how local policy and brand consistency affect customer trust.

title: Marketing Analytics
section: A/B Analysis for Instagram Content Themes
text:
A/B Analysis for Instagram Content Themes
As part of an independent case study, I reviewed post engagement data from a small retail business and created a simulated A/B test comparing two types of Instagram post styles: product demos vs. lifestyle photos.
I analyzed: - Engagement metrics (likes, shares, and saves) across 3 weeks of sample posts
- Patterns in time of day, caption length, and post type
- Basic summary statistics and visual comparisons in R
This helped me explore how data-backed decisions can refine a brand’s visual strategy and build more consistent performance across social channels.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Survey-Driven Persona Mapping
I designed and analyzed a mock consumer survey to create customer personas for a hypothetical wellness brand. Questions covered purchase behavior, brand perception, and lifestyle preferences.
Key steps included: - Coding and cleaning multiple-choice survey responses
- Segmenting users into groups based on behavioral patterns
- Drafting detailed persona summaries with visual charts
This project showed how structured data collection can support targeted messaging, product development, and campaign alignment.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Portfolio Website Performance Tracking
As part of building this portfolio site, I established basic performance tracking strategies using mock data to simulate page visits, resume downloads, and link clicks.
I created: - Line graphs to visualize visit frequency over time
- Funnel-style flow charts to simulate user behavior
- Summaries of which sections received the most interest
This reinforced how web analytics supports digital branding and gave me practice applying analysis to content performance in a personal context.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Summary
Marketing analytics has allowed me to bridge technical skills with strategic thinking. From hypothesis testing to content engagement analysis, I’ve learned how to turn raw data into meaningful insights. I look forward to continuing to apply these tools in roles that require both curiosity and clarity.
